title: Bug 7734: System shuts down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows causes the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: When shutting down the computer while a WSWB session is open with unsaved changes in a .txt file, a warning or question message box should appear, prompting users to save their changes before the computer is shut down.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Start WSWB and create a new project. 
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. 
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file. 
4. Left-click on the Windows Start menu and select the "Shut Down" command to shut down or reboot the computer. 

Expected result: 
A warning or question message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their unsaved changes before the computer is shut down or rebooted. 

Additional note: 
Other Windows programs (like Word, Outlook, etc.) provide similar warnings before shutting down to prevent data loss.
